alert.note: Alert for Motherlode; Northeast Foothills, Sacramento Valley; West Slope Northern Sierra Nevada; Western Plumas County, Lassen Park (California) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued May 28 at 3:25PM PDT by NWS Sacramento
info.description: ...A strong thunderstorm will impact portions of south central Plumas, southeastern Butte and northeastern Yuba Counties through 415 PM PDT... At 324 PM PDT, Doppler radar was tracking a strong thunderstorm near Feather Falls, or 9 miles southeast of Brush Creek Rs, moving west at 5 mph. HAZARD...Winds in excess of 30 mph and pea size hail. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Gusty winds could knock down tree limbs and blow around unsecured objects. Minor damage to outdoor objects is possible. Locations impacted include... Brush Creek Rs, Hurleton, Feather Falls, Forbestown and Challenge-Brownsville. MAX HAIL SIZE...0.25 IN MAX WIND GUST...30 MPH
info.instruction: If outdoors, consider seeking shelter inside a building. Frequent cloud to ground lightning is occurring with this storm. Lightning can strike 10 miles away from a thunderstorm. Seek a safe shelter inside a building or vehicle. Persons in campgrounds should consider seeking sturdy shelter until this storm passes.

area.areaDesc: Motherlode; Northeast Foothills, Sacramento Valley; West Slope Northern Sierra Nevada; Western Plumas County, Lassen Park
